[[1889]] | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage=[[Oswin Lowdham]] | siblings= | spouse= | children=[[Alwin Arundel Lowdham]] | gender=Male | height=Tall | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Edwin Lowdham''' was the father of [[Alwin Arundel Lowdham]]. == History == Edwin was a wealthy man, and had a great passion for the sea. He spent a great deal of time sailing about [[wikipedia:Norway|Norway]], [[wikipedia:Scotland|Scotland]], [[wikipedia:Ireland|Ireland]], [[wikipedia:Iceland|Iceland]] and sometimes even going as far south as to the [[wikipedia:Azores|Azores]]. In [[1947]] he set sail in his ship the [[Éarendel]] with only three sailors accompanying him, and was never seen again.{{SD|2d}}, "Night 66" Later, his son Arundel found a manuscript written in [[Tengwar]] which contained an account of the [[Downfall of Númenor]] in [[Old English]] written by Edwin.{{SD|2d}}, "Night 68" == Appearance == He is described by his son as being large, tall, powerful and dark. == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | OSW |OSW=[[Oswin Lowdham]]

[[1938]]''}} {{familytree/end}} == Etymology == The name [[Wikipedia:Edwin|Edwin]] ([[Old English]]: [[Éadwine]]) contains the elements ''ead'' "bliss" (seen also in ''[[Éadig]]'') and ''wine'' "friend".{{webcite|website=Behind the Name|articlename=Edwin|articleurl=http://www.behindthename.com/name/edwin}} == See also == *[[Amandil]] *[[Éadwine]] *[[Audoin Errol]] {{references}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lowdham, Edwin}} [[Category:Characters from the later Ages]] [[Category:English people (in-universe)]] [[Category:Mariners]] [[Category:The Notion Club Papers]]
